body.p: To his Excellency Gov Thos E. Bramlette --

Your Petitioner Pleasant J Zackary, was fined by the Lexington City Court $50 for carrying "concealed deadly weapons". He was a member of the 1st Ky Cavry and was dischard Oct 23-1865. Was on his way home, bought a small pocket pistol in Lex Ky. saw some friends drank too much, was arrested and the pistol found on his person. He feels it a great hardship to be confined in the "Work-House" after being absent from his family for four years. He prays your Excellency will remit the fine & he will every pray &c
We the undersigned would recommend the remission of foregoing fine --

Speed S. Goodloe
J. L. C. C
D C Wickliffe
J. H. Harrison
John B. Payne Jr.
W W Dewden
D, S, Goodloe
John S. Miller

Lexington City Ct
vs
Pleasant J. Zackary
$20.
24th Nov 1865
